org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON,NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF the application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
3038 ASSIGNMENT OF ERRORS.

COMES NOW FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF, the petitioner above named, by Geo. D. Emery Esq. his attorney, and files the following assignment of errors upon which he will rely upon his appeal from the decision, order and judgment made and entered by this Honorable Court on the 30th day of September A. D. 1915, in the above entitled cause, denying the petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and for discharge of the petitioner.
A.- The United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in granting the motion of the State of Washington to quash the writ issued herein.
B.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in denying the Writ o f Habeas Corpus, as prayed in the petition herein.

C.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in refusing to discharge the petitioner from custody and from imprisonment, as prayed in his petition herein.

D.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in holding that the law of te the State of Washington set forth in the petition herein, under which the petitioner was convicted of practicing dentistry without a license etc., was and is valid and in refusing to hold the same void and in contravention of the provisions of Article XIV of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States.

E.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in holding that the law of the State of Washington under which petitioner was convicted of the alleged offense of practicing dentistry without a license was not
in contravention of the provisions of Article V of the Amendments to the Constitution of the United States., and in refusing to hold the said state law void.
F.- The United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, erred in rendering judgment herein against the petitioner.

WHEREFORE the said petitioner , appellant, prays that the judgment of said Court be reversed and such directions be given that the petitioner, appellant, may be discharged from custody and that full force and efficiency may inure to the petitioner, appellant, by reason of the facts, matters and things set up in his petition filed in this cause.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Attorney for petitioner and appellant herein.
div1.p: 419 Central Building Seattle, Wash.
ORIGINAL No.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
Service of within Assignment this 30 day of Sept 1915 and receipt of a copy thereof, admitted,
div1.ab: Frank P Helswell Attorneys for Respt
div1.p: In Re Application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Assignment of Errors
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western District of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION SEP301915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: 2x
Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Appellant Telephone: Elliottt 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS"
